intro: Cryptantha hispidula var. elmeri, commonly known as Elmer's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is characterized by its hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves.
